Module FloWeekTracker

Package com.floweektracker.view

package com.floweektracker.view
View package contains the UI components of the application responsible for displaying and interacting with the user. All components are Swing-based. This package should not contain any business logic or persistent-related code. Components depend on controllers to handle logic and are updated by the service layer.

Class overview:

  • CleanerView - a dialog allowing the user to select the days of the week for a cleaning operation, e.g. delete all tasks or reset points; implemented as a singleton
  • InfoView - a JPanel displaying information about using the application
  • MainPanelView - a JPanel representing the main view of the application after launching; implemented as a singleton
  • PlannerView - a JTable representing a weekly planner; implemented as a singleton
  • TaskAddingDialogView - a dialog used to add a new task
  • TaskDialogView - a builder for dialogs used to add or edit a task
  • TaskEditingDialogView - a dialog used to edit an existing task
  • TaskNamesDialogView - a dialog used to add or remove task names; implemented as a singleton
  • WeekdayPlannerView - a JPanel displaying all tasks for a given day with their details
See Also:
  • com.floweektracker.controller
  • com.floweektracker.service
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    com.floweektracker
     
    com.floweektracker.controller
    Controller package contains classes responsible for handling user actions and coordinating communication between views and services.
    com.floweektracker.model
    Model package contains classes that represent the data used in the application.
    com.floweektracker.repository
    Repositories package contains the data access layer responsible for connecting to the JSON-based storage system.
    com.floweektracker.service
    Service package contains the business logic of the application responsible for managing user data and application state.
    com.floweektracker.util
    Util package contains utility classes which are used in multiple classes.
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    CleanerView
    Represents the UI component responsible for displaying a dialog that allows the user to select the days of the week for performing a cleaning operation.
    InfoView
    Represents UI of the information panel which shows to the user details about database or planner using.
    MainPanelView
    Represents the UI of the main panel displayed to the user after launching the application.
    PlannerView
    Represents a UI of the planner which is used to display a weekly planner to the user based on their tasks.
    TaskAddingDialog
    UI of the task adding dialog that allows the user to add a task to the planner.
    TaskDialogView
    Builder for the UI dialogs related to task management.
    TaskDialogView.TaskDialogBuilder
    Inner static class for building task dialog views with various components.
    TaskEditingDialog
    UI of the task editing dialog that allows the user to edit a task in the planner.
    TaskNamesDialog
    Represents the UI of the task names database allowing users to add and remove task names in a database.
    WeekdayPlannerView
    Represents UI of the schedule for a given weekday, displaying the name of the weekday, its schedule and a return button to the user.
